issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Job recovery fails after killing all the running containers for the app

comments.body: approx 15s after job submission we find the running container for the app and kill the process. For this test the client reported the failure but the job actually restarted on a different host and finished successfully.

It could be the reason that after the 1st AM is killed but before the 2nd AM is registered, the old AM's port/host still remain in RM , when JobClient tries to query RM, RM gives back the old port/host, which leads JobClient to fail.

In fact, the reason is after the 1st AM is killed and before the 2nd AM attempt is created, JobClient keeps querying RM for the AM host/port and RM responds back 1st AM's host/port. If job client invokes any method that talks with the 1st AM beyond MR_CLIENT_MAX_RETRIES, job client will eventually fail.

upload a patch that if it's AM connection failure, do not decrement retry count. AM will restarted in the future. 
In the case that job really failed and AM will not be restarted, JobClient will query RM for the final status.

  against trunk revision .

    {color:red}-1 patch{color}.  Trunk compilation may be broken.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/4005//console

This message is automatically generated.

There are two configs: client.max-retries and client-am.ipc.max-retries and both are set to 3 by default. So I'm surprised we are seeing this. Can you debug more. 

Irrespective I think it's a good patch to have. Comments on the patch:
 - Unrelated import com.jcraft.jsch.Proxy.
 - 'MRCLientRroxy' Typos.
 - maxClientToAMRetry is not really clientToAMRetries anymore as you are just using for JHS? If so, we may have to take care of the config properties - remove/deprecate them and add a different config for JHS connections.
 - Similarly getMaxClientToAMretry() may need to be renamed and marked as @VisibleForTesting
 - Between each failure, there should be a sleep, otherwise client will just keep on pinging RM in a tight loop.
 - To better simulate the failure in the test, you may have to throw RuntimeException more than three times.

bq. maxClientToAMRetry is not really clientToAMRetries anymore as you are just using for JHS?
Turns out it's also used for RM, named as maxClientRetry?

bq. There are two configs: client.max-retries and client-am.ipc.max-retries and both are set to 3 by default. 
mapred-default.xml sets client-am.ipc.max-retries as 1, so it always picks up 1 if no user config is provided. Changed it to 3.

Fixed other comments also.
